main event: A very bright light object was observed in the sky over Fort Pierce, Florida on February 27, 1956.
interesting points: The object was round, sometimes cigar-shaped, and had prongs.
The object was the size of a 50-cent piece and had a yellowish-white color.
The object was bright enough to be seen through the clouds.
The object moved in an erratic arc to the north.
The object faded over the horizon after about 3 minutes of observation.
witnesses: a civilian observer and a Ground Observer Corps (GOC) observer
